DOC.brief_summary: Dying patient family face many challenge near end-of-life . Not patient often experience physical distress , also feelings loss dignity , isolation , uncertainty . Family member also face many challenge . They bear witness suffer loved one , face uncertainty , loss , time mount sense helplessness . The purpose study introduce evaluate new intervention call Dignity Talk , meant enhance end-of-life experience patient family . Dignity Talk base set question terminally ill patient family member engage meaningful conversation . It intend lessen feeling loss helplessness enhance feeling connectedness facilitate conversation tap sense meaning purpose , share memory , wish , hope , give guidance soon leave behind . In Phase 1 , 20 patient family member help finalize method Dignity Talk question framework ( easy understand , investigator right question , word sensitive ) . In Phase 2 study investigator ask 100 patient-family pair feedback Dignity Talk : influence palliative care experience , whether work well , whether intervention become regular part palliative care . The investigator also ask feedback health-care provider phase . Four six month death love one , investigator contact family member ask thought Dignity Talk , shape experience grief bereavement . The investigator expect study show Dignity Talk effective , highly accessible palliative care intervention , enhance end-of-life experience palliative patient family support .
DOC.brief_title: Dignity Talk : Helping Palliative Care Patients Families Have Important Conversations
